title: Religious Rights and State Secrets at SCOTUS
itunes:title: Religious Rights and State Secrets at SCOTUS
description:
Richard Garnett, a professor at Notre Dame Law School, discusses the Supreme Court justices grappling with the religious rights of death-row inmates in the execution chamber.

Ahilan Arulanantham, Faculty Co-Director of the Center for Immigration Law and Policy at UCLA School of Law, discusses Supreme Court oral arguments where he represented three Muslim men who sued the FBI for spying on them.

June Grasso hosts.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
